intro: Scrophularia erecta, commonly known as upright scrophularia, is a herbaceous perennial plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It typically grows to a height of 30–90 cm, featuring upright stems covered in fine hairs. The plant produces showy, two-lipped flowers that range in color from pink to purple, often with a distinctive yellow throat. Its leaves are opposite, ovate to lanceolate, and have a serrated margin. Scrophularia erecta is often found in moist, calcareous soils in woodland edges and meadows.
